thread.title: Leicester star Demarai Gray punished after England under-21 winger posted online laughing gas video
thread.title_full: Leicester star Demarai Gray punished after England under-21 winger posted online laughing gas video

author: wdownes
title: Leicester star Demarai Gray punished after England under-21 winger posted online laughing gas video
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments LEICESTER and England starlet Demarai Gray has been punished by the club for foolishly posting a video online of him apparently inhaling laughing gas just hours after another disappointing defeat. 
The 20-year-old Foxes winger decided to let his hair – and balloon – down on Boxing Day after his side was turned over by Everton . Getty Images 3 Demarai Gray is set for a stern punishment from manager Claudio Ranieri 
Far from trying to hide his use of the legal but dangerous drug, the £20,000-a-week England under-21 ace posted a video a clip of him at it on the internet with a series of dopey captions. 
Keep up-to-date with all the latest transfer news and gossip ahead of the January window with SunSport’s daily LIVE blog Reuters Gray is in the England U21 set-up and is featuring more for the Foxes saido berahino inhales nitrous oxide west brom 
The former Birmingham prodigy labelled himself a “pro-partier” and informed his Snapchat followers that “lifesrealgoodonthisside”. 
But King Power bosses have revealed that he will be face disciplinary action for the mindless actions. 
A Leicester spokesman said: “We expect the highest standards of behaviour from our players. Demarai has accepted the internal disciplinary process.” EPA Jamie Vardy with a little help from Gray lifted the title last season Manchester City and England winger Raheem Sterling in new hippy crack video Related Stories UK weather warning as temperatures plummet to -5C and icy rain showers blast the country INCHES FROM DEATH Istanbul attack victim Jacob Raak cheats death when Santa Killer's bullet bounces off his MOBILE PHONE Relegation scrap Premier League Live - Middlesbrough take on Leicester side still missing Jamie Vardy who sits out final game of three-match ban VILE OBSESSION Violent paedophile 'will be MORE of a danger when he leaves jail thanks to his bizarre Taxi Driver fixation Special Gest Rudy Gestede to complete £6m Middlesbrough switch after arriving on Teesside to undergo medical Raheem Sterling 'sucks hippy crack' balloon 
The reigning Premier League champions have struggled in the league this season but the flagging form of last season’s stars like Riyad Mahrez has helped Gray make 13 appearances already. 
The youngster is not the first Premier League star to be snapped using nitrous oxide with Spurs’ Kyle Walker, Man City’s Raheem Sterling and West Brom outcast Saido Berahino all getting caught on camera. 
When inhaled using a balloon, the gas gives a short burst of euphoria but nothing worth filming and risking your career for.
